CREATE TABLE courses (
    list INT,
    list_basic_description VARCHAR(1120) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_basic_number VARCHAR(5) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_basic_subject VARCHAR(3) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_basic_title VARCHAR(100) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_add_consent VARCHAR(27) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_career VARCHAR(13) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Class_Lecture VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_DDE VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Directed_Individual_Study VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Discussion VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Dissertation_Defense VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Doctoral_Exam VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Graduate_Dissertation VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Graduate_Thesis VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Individ_Performance_Instructn VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Internship VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Laboratory VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Master_s_Exam VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Medical_Science VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Other VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Specialist_Exam VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Supervised_Research VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Supervised_Teaching VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_course_components_Thesis_Defense VARCHAR(8) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_enrollment_requirement VARCHAR(253) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_grading_basis VARCHAR(30) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_typically_offered VARCHAR(20) CHARACTER SET utf8,
    list_extra_units VARCHAR(13) CHARACTER SET utf8
);

INSERT INTO courses VALUES (NULL,'This course enables students to work on a writing project throughout the semester (e.g., journal article, fellowship proposal, or prospectus). INSERT INTO courses VALUES (NULL,'This course introduces students to the materials and mechanics of text in its history of production. Particular topics vary, but each course taught under this number takes the phenomenon of textual production as its core, which might be inscription on stone, or chirographic text, or the evolution of print, or visual and verbal text, or the development of digital media. Students learn to describe and analyze the key historical causes, effects, and attributes of particular materials and forms of textual producation; the reasons behind the development of the particular physical attributes of any medium; and students acquire an ability to use the critical vocabulary of the broader fleild.','5805','ENG','Studies in Textual Production',NULL,'Graduate','Required',NULL,NULL,'Optional',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'Graded',NULL,'3.00');
INSERT INTO courses VALUES (NULL,'This course introduces theories and case studies in the history of textual transformations. Course topics vary, but each course taught under this number takes as its central focus the phenomena of major textual transformations. Examples may include the transformation of texts from script to print or from foliated to digital forms; or textual issues related to translation; cultural and historical changes that both permit and follow from major textual shifts; the reception problems involved in the textual transformations of particular authors'' works or particular genres of literature. The course attends to specific technical mechanisms of textual transformation and to their broadest literary-cultural effects.','5807','ENG','Studies in Textual Transformation',NULL,'Graduate','Required',NULL,NULL,'Optional',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,'Graded',NULL,'3.00');

INSERT INTO courses VALUES (NULL,'In this course, students explore blindness, talk with people who are intimately familiar with blindness, and experience adventure under blindfold. INSERT INTO courses VALUES (NULL,'This course provides an introductory survey of various musical traditions in a global perspective, exploring music both as a phenomenon of sound and as a phenomenon of culture. INSERT INTO courses VALUES (NULL,'This course represents the Statistics II requirement for the Social Work Doctoral curriculum.
